namingGuidelines.title: Route Naming Guidelines
namingGuidelines.intro: When naming a route, please follow these guidelines:

items.respectfulInclusive: Keep names respectful and inclusive - avoid offensive, discriminatory or inappropriate content
items.ageAppropriate: Use names appropriate for all ages
items.respectLocalCultures: Respect local cultures and Indigenous/First Nations peoples
items.considerNamingThemes: Consider existing naming themes in the area
items.ensureUniqueWithinArea: Ensure the name is unique within the climbing area
items.appropriateForPublicDisplay: Names should be appropriate for public display and publication

namingGuidelines.reminder: Remember: Route names become part of the climbing community's legacy and should reflect positively on the sport.

tags.confirmDeleteTag: Are you sure you want to delete this tag?

footer.tagline: Secure boulder topo and session tracker. A hobby project for the bouldering community.

dangerZone.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this {{name}}?

grade.title: Grade
grade.opinionDescription: This grade is merely a suggestion and not the final grade of the route. Users can state their opinion on the grade when logging an ascent of the route.
grade.averageDescription: The final grade will be the average of all the opinions.

rating.title: Rating
rating.description: As objective as possible try to consider these factors:

factors.rockQuality: The quality of the rock and holds
factors.landingQuality: The quality of the landing area
factors.surroundingBeauty: The beauty of the surrounding area
factors.topoutOrDropoff: Is there a topout or only a dropoff?

hero.title: Protect Your Private Land Bouldering Areas
hero.subtitle: Professional area management for sensitive access locations. Keep your development projects secure, collaborate with your community, and never lose your data again.

problem.title: Why Area Developers Choose Privacy-First Tools
problem.paragraph1: Developing bouldering areas on private land requires careful balance between community collaboration and access protection. One misplaced coordinate or overshared beta can jeopardize years of relationship building with landowners.
problem.paragraph2: Meanwhile, managing development data across scattered Excel files and email chains creates version conflicts, data loss risks, and collaboration headaches that slow down progress.

features.title: Built for Area Developers Who Value Access

accessProtection.title: Access Protection
accessProtection.description: Keep sensitive areas private with invitation-only communities. Perfect for private land where public exposure risks closure.

professionalCollaboration.title: Professional Collaboration
professionalCollaboration.description: Replace email chains and version conflicts. Your entire team sees updates instantly with proper change tracking.

dataIntegrity.title: Data Integrity
dataIntegrity.description: Import your Excel files and upgrade to professional area management. Never lose development work to corrupted files again.

completeAreaManagement.title: Complete Area Management
completeAreaManagement.description: Organize areas, sectors, and problems with detailed topos, grades, and conditions. Built specifically for boulder development.

developmentDocumentation.title: Development Documentation
developmentDocumentation.description: Document first ascents, cleaning progress, and project status. See how your area evolves over time with detailed analytics.

easyMigration.title: Easy Migration
easyMigration.description: Import existing problem lists from Excel or CSV. Migrate decades of development work in minutes, not months.

areaDevelopers.title: Area Developers
areaDevelopers.description: First ascentionists and route setters managing ongoing development projects

localCommunities.title: Local Communities
localCommunities.description: Tight-knit climbing groups with sensitive access areas requiring discretion

privateLandStewards.title: Private Land Stewards
privateLandStewards.description: Landowners and permitted groups managing sustainable access programs

integration.title: When You're Ready to Go Public
integration.description: Once access is secured and areas are established, easily export your data to public platforms when appropriate.
